dmca.title: [ABUSE] Stolen Content
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Nick Valoti [mailto:website@addglitter.com] 
Sent: Monday, March 27, 2006 4:53 PM
To: 'Legal Response'
Cc: website@addglitter.com; legal@adoko.com
Subject: RE: [ABUSE] Stolen Content

As quoted straight from your disclaimer;

"Customers may not transmit, distribute, download, copy, cache, host, or
otherwise store on a Server any information, data, material, or work that
infringes the intellectual property rights of others. The Planet has the
right to disable access to, or remove, infringing content to the extent
required under any law or regulation, including the Digital Millennium
Copyright Act of 1998."

Quite clearly one of your customers IS illegally copying my material; See
the page here. 

http://www.htmllive.com/sparkle/index.php

compared to;

www.addglitter.com

It is plainly obvious which one is the original. I have all the original
graphics files to support my claims.

If however, you are still in doubt and need yet further evidence - view the
contents of this file;

http://www.htmllive.com/sparkle/addglitter.js

This code contains the text "addglitter.com" all over it. Obviously the
owner forgot to alter that. The original on my server is located here;

www.addglitter.com/addglitter.js

Since Service providers ARE expected to remove material from users' web
sites that appears to constitute copyright infringement I would expect this
content to be removed or otherwise I will be forced to take legal action for
damages regarding the content in question. 

Regards,
Nick Valoti
http://www.addglitter.com

-----Original Message-----
From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com]
Sent: Friday, March 24, 2006 2:36 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] Stolen Content

This message was received at abuse@theplanet.com on Friday, March 24, 2006
at
04:20:11 and concerns a matter for which responsibility is delegated to your
team. The message and headers follow.

Thank you,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

SUBJECT:
[ABUSE] Stolen Content

MESSAGE BODY:
Hi,

The site 

http://www.htmllive.com/

is full of stolen copyright content which I found to be hosted by you. Each
of the the drop-down menu represents a site which is stolen.

For example my site is;
www.addglitter.com

they copied this at;
http://www.htmllive.com/sparkle

I will need to take further action if the content is not removed.

Regards,
Nick Valoti
